melee: 2 claws +18 (2d6+7/18-20/×3 plus grab and 1d6 bleed), tentacles +16 (1d10+3 plus poison)

spells.spell-like abilities:
(CL 11th; concentration +14)

Constant-detect good, detect magic, see invisibility

At will-dispel magic, greater teleport (self plus 50 lbs. of objects only)

3/day-fly, stinking cloud (DC 16)

1/day-summon (level 4, 1d3 hydrodaemons 35%)

feats: Critical Focus, Improved Initiative, Multiattack, Power Attack, Sickening Critical, Vital Strike
senses: darkvision 60 ft., detect good, detect magic, see invisibility; Perception +16
description: This hideous cross between a lobster, an octopus, and a human threatens enemies with powerful claws and writhing tentacles.

sections.body: A piscodaemon's claws threaten a critical hit on an 18–20 and inflict ×3 damage on a successful critical hit.
sections.name: Augmented Critical

sections.body: These aquatic daemons roam the lower planes sowing misery and blight. They delight in drawn-out deaths, poisoning creatures or dismembering victims to watch them slowly bleed out. On their home plane of Abaddon, piscodaemons gravitate toward the same aquatic regions inhabited by hydrodaemons, and often the stronger among their ranks end up leading armies of hydrodaemons against their enemies. These creatures serve as sergeants in the hierarchy of Abaddon, and run their units with an excess of cruelty and violence.

Instead of preying on the weak, piscodaemons enjoy targeting strong, well-armored warriors, knowing the pain of their weakening poison rests poorly on shoulders accustomed to bearing heavy weights and delivering devastating blows.
Piscodaemons are 7 feet tall and weigh 400 pounds.

name: Daemon, Piscodaemon
skills: Escape Artist +18, Intimidate +17, Knowledge (planes) +16, Perception +16, Sense Motive +16, Stealth +18, Survival +16, Swim +29
